metadata.title: CVE-2020-36242 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the cryptography package before 3.3.2 for Python, certain sequences ofupdate calls to symmetrically encrypt multi-GB values could result in aninteger overflow and buffer overflow, as demonstrated by the Fernet class.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36242` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-cryptography - 1.2.3-1ubuntu0.3
python3-cryptography - 1.2.3-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-cryptography package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.3-1ubuntu0.3').
